{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3684664,"name":"wyatt","username":"stormsj28","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a3d4f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-19T05:27:00.823Z","cooked":"

working on a few offseason (personal) projects just thought it’d be fun to post progress here. the general idea may change for all of them but will keep working on them. most of these will stay in the cad phase but some will continue to be built, I’m currently working on a reaction wheel control system (research for it) for Areial vehicles (rockets and planes) I’ve had idea for a mars rover style project and some FRC based projects. lots of these will be based on Arduino control systems.

I will just post updates for all of my projects and maybe some questions.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-07-19T05:27:00.823Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":340,"readers_count":339,"score":228.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":504411,"topic_slug":"summer-ish-projects","display_username":"wyatt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76247,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3218 CAD"},"post_url":"/t/summer-ish-projects/504411/1","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3685113,"name":"wyatt","username":"stormsj28","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a3d4f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-20T02:21:28.614Z","cooked":"

Update: day one reaction wheel project: found many online resources on reaction wheel design, theory of design and use cases from NASA and the MIT opencourseware site (wonderful resource definitely check them out) the MIT rocket team website also had some great things. created a simple mass budget calculator in google sheets and aiming for less than 500 grams for the initial prototype. the project will run on an Odrive s1 and a CAN to USB-C from them as well. the entire project will have to fit inside a 98mm (sorry freedom units) blue tube airframe from apogee rockets and run off of a small battery (will be the highest MAH 4cell LIPO in the remaining weight budget)

If anyone wants any links to some rabbit holoes about the things i’ve found or even the weight budget chart let me know:)

for my question today, has anyone used any cnc machining services like pcbway offers? what do you think of them? are there any other services out there?(looking for a machining service for the physical flywheel/reaction wheel though may end up 3d printed with metal like screws or something.)

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-07-20T02:26:45.524Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":273,"readers_count":272,"score":114.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":504411,"topic_slug":"summer-ish-projects","display_username":"wyatt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":76247,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3218 CAD"},"post_url":"/t/summer-ish-projects/504411/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3685592,"name":"wyatt","username":"stormsj28","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/a3d4f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-07-20T19:11:14.951Z","cooked":"

stayed up until about 1am last night getting some initial CAD work done, have a technical drawing for the v1.0 (fly/reaction wheel idek anymore) as well.

Screenshot 2025-07-20 115517861×660 38.6 KB

all dimensions in mm. I know that lots of the dimensions and the part box isn’t very standard so if anyone has anything I should add or a better way to do things I’m open to suggestions. the flywheel will likely be made out of brass because it has a relatively high density and wont rust. (rust will change MOI and total weight)
Screenshot 2025-07-20 010356943×693 73.7 KB

This is the motor + wheel assembly, the motor was a very simple model I made of this motor here, it has all of the holes and clearances I think are necessary. I’ve decided to cad the screws due to the weight budget and it will be good practice for my later projects. I’m going to start on the MOI math and the torques on the motor (to find current draw) to determine the batteries I will get for it, looking for around 8minutes of 100% speed run time.

3d printed prototype is now complete. Going to hold off on moi for now and work more on the casing that will sit between it and the tube frame.

Took a two day break and continued the motor mount CAD today, fixed some old math that was wrong in the weight budget and nearly finished final CAD. Officially under 500 grams not including airframe or wiring, the batteries will likely change as they take up 99 grams I still need weight for the wiring and airframe.

Question for today: are there any good 4s lipos that are around the 850-1200mah range that you have used before, if not are there any lightweight wires you/ your team uses? The final question I have, are there any specific filaments your team or you have used that you really liked for any reason? Is there any reason the mounting bracket can’t be petg or pla?

edit: fixed images

Screenshot 2025-07-23 192809946×307 14.4 KB

are there any weight savings to be had with cf filaments or do they add weight? i have access to quite i few bambu printers and wondering if it’d be worth the time and effort or should i use pla/ petg.

side note: i may outsource the 3d printed mount for some onyx or something if i think it’d be worth it.

I am still learning filament types and when it’s best to use them. This season our team used the Bambu PPA-CF for a couple items on our bot. The one that really showed it’s worth was the herringbone gear on our wrist. It held up shockingly well and we would say it compares well to aluminum in that scenario while being lighter. It is not a cheap setup though. The roll itself is near $200 for half a spool. We used a Bambu X1E and a Creality Dryer with heat. All that is to say, the biggest downside with the CF filament is the cost in my experience.
